item.title: Volumes of Regular Hyperbolic Simplices
item.description: arXiv:2508.20450v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We derive an explicit formula for the volume of a regular simplex in the hyperbolic space of any dimension.
item.dc:creator: Zakhar Kabluchko, Philipp Schange

item.title: Finite dimensional amenable groups
item.description: arXiv:2508.20296v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We show that an amenable group of finite Assouad-Nagata dimension satisfies the property $H_{FD}$ of Shalom. Such infinite groups are known to admit a virtual homomorphism onto $\mathbb{Z}$, and thus our result implies that an amenable group of finite $AN$-dimension cannot be a simple group. We can also conclude that an amenable group of finite $AN$-dimension cannot be a torsion group. Our proof is based on new estimates of diameters of F{\o}lner couples. We prove that any amenable group of finite $AN$-dimension admits F{\o}lner couples inside balls of linear diameter and more generally estimate the radius of the balls containing F{\o}lner couples in groups of finite asymptotic dimension. This result strengthens the result of Nowak about diameters of F{\o}lner sets.
item.dc:creator: Anna Erschler, Ivan Mitrofanov

item.title: On general versions of the Petty projection inequality
item.description: arXiv:2503.00949v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The classical Petty projection inequality is an affine isoperimetric inequality which constitutes a cornerstone in the affine geometry of convex bodies. By extending the polar projection body to an inter-dimensional operator, Petty's inequality was generalized to the so-called $(L_p,Q)$ setting, where $Q$ is an $m$-dimensional compact convex set. In this work, we further extend the $(L_p,Q)$ Petty projection inequality to the broader realm of rotationally invariant measures with concavity properties, namely, those with $\gamma$-concave density (for $\gamma\geq-1/nm$). Moreover, when $p=1$, and motivated by a contemporary empirical reinterpretation of Petty's result, we explore empirical analogues of this inequality.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Mar\'in Sola
